Nature
You are the son of 1st and 2nd among us and brother of 3rd among us. Therefore, due to our great love for you, we have decided to give you some property. After our death, we inherited a vacant land of 242 sq.m. acquired by our ancestors and enjoyed it with all rights. Later, 1st among us, with his own money, constructed a house with door no. 2-57 and constructed a latrine and bathroom, and the Panchayat taxes etc. were paid in the name of 1st among us. We are paying. We hereby transfer to you the property listed in the Schedule below, which has been our full right of possession up to the present date, free of charge, and we hereby relinquish all rights we have in the Schedule property and transfer all such rights to you. 1
Sikhampalli Durgarandra
5. Rajeswari

From now on, you shall have all the rights of donation, exchange, sale, payment of Panchayat taxes, etc. in your own name and shall enjoy the water, stone, water and other resources arising therefrom freely and as you wish. If you enjoy it in this way, neither you nor your heirs nor we nor our heirs will be able to make any claims. Whatever claims may arise from any person or entity in relation to the property listed in the schedule below, we will avoid all such claims at our own expense and We hereby declare to you that the Scheduled Property is our sole and undisputed property with full rights and enjoyment. We hereby declare to you that we have not sold, leased, guaranteed or otherwise transferred the Scheduled Property to anyone else. This affidavit/declaration is to inform that after making a local inquiry into the affairs of the Scheduled Property, at the time of preparing this document, we have thoroughly examined all the necessary details related to the said property, such as the original documents/pattadar pass books/title deeds/adangal/ROR-1B/house tax receipt/link documents/heirs/ and EC details, details of the parties in the link documents and property details, names, addresses, photographs, etc. of the parties in the Aadhar cards, etc., and have included them in this document and prepared the document. Done. No matter that should have been written or included in this document has been omitted. The document has been drawn up after physically inspecting and measuring the Scheduled Property.
In the future, if any notice is given to pay any stamp duty or registration fee in relation to this property, whether during spot inspection/internal inspection/annual inspection/inspection conducted by the authorities, I/We will respond immediately and pay the said stamp duty or registration fee. In case of delay in payment, I/We will be liable for any civil/criminal action taken by the Government against me/us.
I/We shall be fully responsible for any legal matters arising in relation to this property in the future. Neither the Sub-Registrar, nor the office staff, nor the document writer have any relationship or responsibility.
This is true.

encumbranceDetails.description: VILL/COL: CHINAPALEM/CHINAPALEMALL(0-98) W-B: 0-98SURVEY: 381/1HOUSE: 98-2-57EXTENT: 242SQ.YdsBUILT: 1103SQ. FTBoundires: [N]:PIDAPARTHI SOWRISITE [S] YALAMATIJHANSI SITE [E]:PANCHAYATI CCROAD [W]: BULLAMARIYADAS SITE

sections.content:
The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 248 of 2026, dated 17/Jan/2026, executed by 1. Sikhapalli Durgarao, 2. Sikhapalli Rajeswarai, 3. Sikapalli Sudhakirthi  in favour of Sikhapalli Prudhvikiran (Whereas Donee is the Son of 1st & 2nd Donor and Brother of 3rd Donor), towards the property admeasuring an extent of 242 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 2-57, Block No. 02, comprised in survey number 381-1, situated in China Palem Village & Grama Panchayati, Duggirala Mandal, within the District of Guntur, registered at sub-registrar office Tenali, is bounded as follows:

North by: Pidaparthi Sowri Site
South by: Yalamati Jhansi Site
East by: Panchayati CC Road
West by: Bullamariyadas Site
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
